comments.body: It lacks something, but I can't tell what...
What would black ice be used for?
Nathan Lewis black ice can be used to make a new building block called black bricks crafted from 4 netherbrick and 4 black ice.
the only cold biome in the nether, make it super rare and replace enderman with wither skeletons, and when the black ice is broken a big cloud of smoke erupts
Why would you go there?
Dude/dudett, I think this is actually a great idea. I think it should have more votes than it actually does, and I will tell my friends about this. 5 star rating.
Dude/dudett, I think this is actually a great idea. I think it should have more votes than it actually does, and I will tell my friends about this. 5 star rating.
Maybe a 1x1 full of water with either coral or sea pickles, plus a tropical fish.
Maybe crabs should be native to tide pools
Some mobs could be sea snails, starfish, crabs, oysters, or clams
anemones would be cool
Sea urchins, octopi and star fish could spawn there too

This could be more possible with the newer rocky cliff/beaches in the recent experimental snapshots, have another rare biome that you can get coral from, especially since they've added local water tables, its definetly a doable feature.
I agree that they should rethink biome rarity in general.  The special biomes are great, but it gets really boring when you can never find them.
Yes, PLEASE!!!!  I spent a whole week in survival looking for melons so I could create healing potions to fight the Enderdragon!
Also, deserts are too common.  they should have less of a chance, and jungles should have more of a chance.
theyre a bit laggy though
This needs to happen. I can't find jungles anywhere and have been playing my survival world for nearly a month. Very frustrating as it's my favourite biome!
ive never had any problems finding jungles...is this a 1.13 thing?
I have been looking for jungle for days üòÆ‚òπÔ∏è (real life time), I really would like to see a more balanced desert to jungle ratio.
I couldn't agree more. Jungles have so many cool and unique features, yet they're one of the rarest biomes, which doesn't really make any sense to me.
Oooooo!  Another thing to add a spooky aspect to the game!!
Don't know about the mob part specifically, but the overall idea of a fog biome is very good
I think this is a great idea you should elaborate more!
Really nice idea. I like that it would give soul torches a use.
Maybe when you bring a spyglass into the foggy hollows, the spyglass doesn't work anymore and gets all foggy. Then you would have to wash the spyglass in a cauldron to make it clear again.
That sounds like fun
that is an ingenious Idea, would be perfect for minecraft
Was about to pitch that idea

I was also about to pitch this idea. I think a snowy or icy cave biome is a necessity if biomes are being added to caves because it does not make much sense to be in a lush cave biome underneath a frozen tundra.

Along with this crashed end ships would be found in the deserts. Add more features and ideas down below :). Flying I enchanted books would also be found here and would give you more control over the speed of the elytra, making it faster and slower/ more sensitive for better and cooler control
Cant really think of an unique mob to live there, i would put in normal mobs but the have a random level 2 effect and are slightly stronger with higher chances to have good armor

"end stone would contain loot at your own risk of dangerous redstone traps"

Maybe end temples that have loot you can only get there and are super rare. Maybe the temple has redstone and maybe new redstone item traps, or traps that can almost instantly kill you if u have low health.

I think if only sparce biomes with few trees were warped into the end like this, it would be a good idea. The sad, desolate, and forgotten feel of the End would definitely be made more apparent if this biome was added. I think the faded golems in the abandoned villages should be neutral until you open a chest. Whenever walking through the town, the golem would try to give you a warped rose, and follow you around with the flower in hand until you leave the village. 

As for mobs, I think endermites should spawn at the same rate passive mobs spawn in the overworld. I don't know if a new mob besides the golem is necessary for this update, but it would be a welcome addition.

I think the potion effect you are talking about should be nerfed a little bit. maybe 20 minutes? Other than that, I really like this idea.

How about living items for the new mob, like rare flying books, self-sailing boats, and mobile minecarts?

The boats and minecarts would be obtainable, but they would still move on their own.
esta bien el bosque deformado en el end porque en ese bosque tambien hay endermans
more mobs like tamable lizards and passive squirrels
Moose & elk please!
Yasssssssssssssss love this idea!
Hola
Hola mojang quisiera saber si alg√∫n d√≠a se pondr√° meter al juego al ilusionista  talvez en esta actualizaci√≥n no se solo pregunto bye üòé
Can we have an desert update yet the desert is really plain and boring ??
Netherite axe is decently fast, just an iron axe would be fine
Mejoras en los biomes y seguro nuevos biomes
que allan cocodrilos ballenas nuevo bioma nuevo mob y eso
Êñ∞„Éê„Ç§„Ç™„Éº„É†„ÅÆÊùë
More mob for different biomes.
Quisiera que pusieran el brich biome para la 1.20

It would be nice to add a new biome which will bring new insects but GIANTS! Since there are giant bees and giant spiders, why wouldn't there be other insects? In this biome you could find new plants and insects of different sizes with different mechanics, also in this biome you would find old ruins with new things such as: chests with new items and old potions.
Please do this I think this update is gonna be the best one with all the new textures like archeology
Mincraft needs more interesting biomes. Maybe you could add more specific characteristics for each biome plus the end needs more interesting this to do and explore.
Yes I have died several to small magma cubes in my nether hub.

This happens to me all the time, especially in multiplayer. It‚Äôs always annoying to die in Minecraft, but to die and without chance of doing anything to prevent it just makes the game not fun to play. Sometimes you can‚Äôt move or see, but you can hear what‚Äôs happening and you can‚Äôt do anything to prevent it. Maybe some time of invulnerability until you have controle of your character?

I have several nether portals in different locations hundreds of blocks away from each other, and I die about 50% of the time before I am actually loaded and able to move. I can hear magma cubes killing me but I am unable to do anything. It loads me to a dead screen. So dumb, and I agree it makes the game not fun when I built up my inventory to instantly lose it without the opportunity to defend myself. Surely this isn‚Äôt how the game has always been?

Everytime I go to the nether and try to leave, it shows the building terrain/loading world sign. After the loading is complete, I have been killed by magma cubes. After respawning, I covered my portal with cobblestone and made a small enclosure to make sure mobs could not get in. Still, I ended up dead by magma cubes. I have no clue why this happens. But I have yet to successfully leave the nether due to this bug.

I've been having this issue as well. The nether is loading and I hear ghouls hitting me/the portal and once I generate, I am dead and the nether portal is broken. It's become quite frustrating when I have to keep creating nether portals and hope that one generates in a safe location in the nether where I don't die before I can even see anything. I hope they can fix this issue as it is not fair to the player

This glitch has occurred frequently on my server, and not only is it irritating, but it leaves a negative impact on the Minecraft community. I see this a large flaw in the game design and would like for the issue to be extracted from all platforms. When you are left defenseless; being attacked by intangible mobs, dying is virtually inevitable. Regardless of the level of your player‚Äôs health, the outcome remains unchanged. Minecraft has played a crucial factor in my childhood, and through the years, there have been many bugs. Ever since they have been fixed, it has made the game increasingly fun to play. Personally, this is one of those bugs that will enhance my perception of Minecraft, so I am willing to allow myself to give more credibility to the game engineers and developers. Pros or new-comers, it affects all of us Minecraft fans. Therefore, it is important for this issue to heard, and for Minecraft developers to take action to this matter. It will mutually benefit the technology and the community, ultimately making Minecraft a better game all around. At the end of the day, this issue receives 100% of my vote for resolving it, and I believe that this issue will catch the attention of the Minecraft staff if it is left unresolved. Thank you for understanding the importance of the matter from my perspective, and for viewing this extensive, yet critical post. Minecraft is one of my favorite video games; I expect nothing but greater outcomes in the future as the game develops.
Please fix this. Bedrock is unplayable because of this. This is the problem when you treat every world like a server, even when we don't want it.

same thing happened to me now. i was grinding so hard on a new game up until i had diamonds and build a nether portal right beside my home base. had a full set armor and everything, but no chance. loading screen, while loading i could hear im being attacked, was dead the moment the loading screen ended. this is utter bs. i tried 5 times to get my stuff back, no chance in hell. on the other side there are like 20 piglins, all respawning instantly. my home base now, overrun with a lot of piglins and zombie mobs the same amount. before i build the nether portal i didnt have any enemy mobs around...

im not willing to give in activating cheat mode, because i really want to get achievements, but this issue is game breaking !

dont know whats causing it, but seeing in the forums that this problem is around for over two years since it was first reported, seems to me that Mojang doesnt really care about their paying customers...

I‚Äôm absolutely pissed there is no reason I should die before the screen is done loading this need to be a priority fix or your going to have people quit playing.
Hours of work for you just to lose everything and have no control over it. Absolutely ridiculous !
Probably the most annoying thing I've dealt with while playing. I lose all my stuff with no chance to defend myself because by the time I've loaded in I'm barraged with skeleton arrows.

This happened to me with a creeper in the nether. When I went back to look for my items, they were all disappeared. My netherite sword and pickaxe with good enchants and my diamond armor and tools were gone. I can‚Äôt find anything on this but I put lots of work into my world and to lose every thing to a stupid bug makes me not want to play Minecraft anymore.
Same here. Really frustrating. Playing with my kids, started a new world with 1.20, you can't really go through a portal without dying. You spawn in Nether having already died.

Absolutely ridiculous.
Easiest fix would likely be to have the player be invulnerable while standing in the portal.

Having the same problem! found an abandoned nether portal in the overworld and as a result I completed it and went through it, now initially I was a little barraged by magma cube attacks when going through the portal but I figured if I built a cobble stone enclosure type structure around it, this would alleviate my problems so I just went back to the overworld as normal. However when I have then gone back in to the portal after doing a bit of packed ice mining I am now completely barraged by magma cube attacks before I have loaded in to the nether and I am informed that I have died upon the game loading. I have managed to retrieve some of my lost items but I am missing my diamond sword with looting, bane of arthropods and fire aspect on it, it also took around 10-15 attempts to get back into the nether successfully and hot foot it back to my other portal of which I had already built a tunnel to. Additionally, what I have noticed is that when I have now gone back into the nether, the game has built another nether portal almost directly above the original one.

This is happening to me too, it took A LOT of trial and error, but figured out if you crouch with a shield facing the direction you guess youre getting hit as you enter the portal. You have a better chance of surviving this way, depending on what‚Äôs killing you. But i lost so many lvls of XP the first time, and the portal was on fire from a ghast before we finally put it out with half a heart left after dozens of tries of loading into the nether with a death screen. I really hope they fix this soon, i‚Äôm pretty sure it didnt used to be like this.

I have been also encountering this problem. I died several times at the hands of Skeletons and Ghasts before managing to get a foothold in the nether. I built another portal else where and died by a combination of Ghast fire and a Piglin. I could hear the Ghast shooting fireballs while I was still in the loading screen.

I've given up on playthroughs because of this issue. I hate using creative to cheat around this, so the only thing I've come up with as a temporary solution is to build a whole fortress around the portal, with doors and blast resistance blocks, with a roof and a tunnel that leads to the exit, and light up the entire inside and outside and place strings or carpets inside or even lava around it to prevent mobs spawning. 

But please, FIX THIS ISSUE! The game's broing because of this, and I can't afford a $50,000 setup just to enter the freaking nether.
Java and Bedrock player here... this is definitely a bedrock codebase problem. I never have any concerns loading into the nether on Java.

I agree, my nether portal is in an inconvenient space and I keep getting shot off of the platform and into lava by skeletons. I tried relocating the portal but it put me in the same spot, so I tried destroying the portal in the nether but I was killed several times and it's not worth that many diamond pickaxes. It's frustrating to know bedrock nether it automatically harder because we load in before our loading screen goes away.

Yeah I keep trying to enter the nether but unfortunately the portal takes until Minecraft‚Äôs anniversary to load, and ghasts launch fireballs at me, and I have to reload the world and hope no ghasts are nearby the portal. Plus there was a nether fortress right by, so it‚Äôs a really good spawn, and I am not moving my entire base just to get away from the ghasts.
Recently in my hard world, the nether takes SO LONG to load, and not even 1/2 way through spawning in, mobs spawn in before me and by the time I load in I'm instantly killed.
I HATE THIS TOO! IM TRYING TO GET IN THE NETHER BUT I CANT! I KEEP DYING TO PIGLINS!!!
its so annoying and they still havent fixed it

Idea: Obsidian Wasteland. This biome is home to endermites, a very neglected mob in the game. The area is made out of endstone, obsidian, and a new block: Endsidian (or another name, idc). This is a slightly easier to break block that is textured to look like obsidian is coursing through the endstone between the cracks. This block isn't renewable, but can be crafted with 2 obsidian and 2 endstone, making 2 Endsidian. A structure in this biome is the End Ruins. This is like an end city, but with cracked purpur and endstone bricks, most shulkers are gone, but there is one mob here: the Lost Souls. These are the souls of end busters that don't even bust, bro, and their souls are there to guide the player to these End Ruins, but having a very low chance of the End Ruins not being ruined, but actual End Cities. This is just an idea for the topic of End Update, converse about it if you want, I think it's cool.
@CarrotSpin that is a really good Idea I hope it gets added because the end is kind of bland
maybe low gravity in end ?

I think we do not need low gravity because that makes the ender dragon a lot less dangerous. The ender dragon blasts you in the air so you fall and take damage. Maybe it can look like that but you still take damage.
call the end ore enderoid and we have a deal
Call the ore PURE ENDER ORE! GREAT IDEA to HAVE AN END UPDATE!

I feel like the majority of mobs such as Phantoms and the up coming Warden seem like end mobs. Not that they need to be removed from the OverWorld, but added to the end*.

*The warden has to be in the end, i beg of Mojang.

Idea:
Toxic wastes biome
This would be a new biome in the end. It would be littered with pools of toxic sludge, a liquid that can kill a player in two hits. The whole biome itself would be toxic, giving you with the "decay" effect, making you take 1 hp every 10 seconds. You wouldn't be able to heal the damage caused by this effect until you left the biome. There would be a new mob called the toxic chomper which would live in the toxic pools. If you approached a toxic pool, it would come out and attack you, dealing 7 hp to a player with diamond armour, killing them in 3 hits. It would be fast and would have 75 hp. After staying out of its pool for 10 seconds, it would start to take damage, retreat back into its pool and heal. After doing this, it would leave you for a bit. It would look like a big purple/pink crocodile. I haven't really decided what they could drop, but I was thinking of something with to do with potions to help you combat the decay. All of the plants would be dead. The chorus would turn into dead chorus, would become a light brown/yellow and would begin to droop when it reaches 5 blocks. There would be a new "Bush" type block, the same colour as the dead chorus. Around the pools would be a new block type similar to magma, although I haven't decided what it could do yet. There might be a new helpful ore named toxite, which would generate rarely on the surface. It could be unstable, and placing it beside itself could create a massive explosion
Yes mojang this update will rock you up

1.22 The End Update:

  1. End Prisons will be added around the end with a 1/100 chance of spawning on an end island, containing endstone and endstone bricks covered with iron bars. Break in or climb over to discover a double chest with the following loot.

  1. Changes to shipwreck spawning:

Shipwrecks have a 1/32 chance of spawning on a warm ocean chunk within 100 blocks of a sand biome.

  1. Conduits can be placed in the water. Surrounding the conduit with copper blocks gives it a use of 33 blocks. Add amethyst on the next layer makes it become 66 blocks. Finally add prismarine on the outer layer and it will turn into 100 blocks.

1. Ender plains are a new biome made of End Stone, with some patches of buried dirt and gravel. Craft End Soil using two endstone as well as 1 dirt and 1 gravel, giving you four end soil. You cannot grow end beets without hoeing end soil, and then it must be within five blocks of the water source and with one block of a normal beet crop to grow. But with this it is a quick growing crop. Bonemealing works. The ender beetroot soup gives eight food points, crafted with a bowl and six ender beets. Finally, you can also use a bowl on a moonshroom to get ender beet soup. To get the ender beet seeds you have to shear the moonshroom. To get a moonshroom, you must breed two normal cows with enderwheat. Enderwheat is obtained from combining a wheat crop and an ender flower. Also, normal flowers can be crafted with wheat to make flowerwheat. Flowerwheat breeds cows to make a moobloom. Shear mooblooms to get flowers in return. Finally, enderwheat is crafted into enderbread (five food points), and flowerwheat into flowerbread (3.5 food points.)

1. Ender Jungles:

End Jungle: A towering area of higher-than-normal chorus fruit, almost like bamboo. Jack O'Lanterns and Carved Pumpkins will uniquely spawn. Silverfish and Ender Mites are a common sight. End Bushes can be sheared for sweet berries. Inhabited by Endermen. Have a 1/50 chance to spawn on a Barren End Island. Ender Prisons have a 1/100 chance of spawning on a barren end island--and a 1/5,000 chance of spawning in an End Jungle. An end jungle temple has a 1/2 chance of spawning in an end jungle, or a 1/200 chance of spawning on any barren end island, but only in an end jungle. Inside lie TNT, tripwire hooks, pressure plates, and silverfish and ender mite spawners. In the middle lie double chests full of loot that would normally be found in  Ender Prisons. The Jungle Temple will be made from chiseled endstone, endstone bricks, and endstone, as well as other variants.

1. end volcano is the mountain pouring down with lava, but a place to gather obsidian, enderrack (red endstone), and magma. On a volcano biome, unique particles fill the air and the end sky becomes red. enderrack forms the bottom of the volcano, with obsidian in the middle, and finally magma at the top. Enderrack is easier to break than Endstone, but harder than netherrack. There will be the buried remains of 2-3 end huts, that were sadly destroyed in an ancient explosion. regular barren islands, by the way, this only has a 1/50 chance of spawning in patches of one. Below the huts remain packs of TNT. If lava touches it, the hut will blow up. okay, the hut structure shall be built like this: End stone brick slabs for a roof, then cobwebs or slabs or nothing for the one block in the windows. Finally, the corners will be built out of enderrack or endstone, and the other parts out of endstone. The structure will be mostly buried with enderrack or endstone, depending. The doors will be made from crimson wood. Inside lies a bed and a chest, containing the following loot: The End volcano, like the end jungle, has a 1/50 chance of spawning.

I think Microsoft should take some advice from the better end mod, and add it into vanilla Minecraft!
is this was added them I think that the bottled sulphur should have a purpose like dragons breath. I think that using it to make splash potion radius bigger would be cool.
Could be combined with this idea: https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360055507312-Brimstone-Caves-Nether-Update-

If/when Mojang decides it's time for a cave update, this is what's needed. Sulfur.
The development team is most likely fully aware of this, but sulfur is capable of going "boom", Mojang.

This is how you help players get gun powder for TNT, Elytra rockets, etc. It would help players who don't quite understand the workings of a creeper farm, AND make it easier to access in peaceful mode(because other than chests, there's literally no other way to get gun powder in peaceful...)

Please, Mojang. Add Sulfur to a cave update if you ever do one.
JOAO. GABIEL

Oceans need to be much larger.  If I'm in the middle of an ocean I don't want to be able to see land nearby.  It's impossible to build an island in the middle of the ocean because the oceans are too small.  Build anything and there's land nearby.

To be honest, I really enjoyed pre-1.7 world generation, even with all of it's flaws. The sparce continents brought players together and made player interaction more common, be it PVP or cooperation. An overabundance of land in modern versions made many multiplayer servers feeling like barely connected singleplayer sessions, rather than true multiplayer, players rarely if ever interact outside of late-game trading.
Every player should have the option of playing their own way and have the access to every feature, but if they want to choose to isolate themselves from multiplayer, it should be a reasonably high challange (Reqiuring them to travel up to a 1000 blocks, build infrastructure through oceans etc.).

I agree. 1.7.2 was an over-correction. We want smaller oceans, not lakes. Interconnected, can't see the other side, but not so big that you get bored and give up even with a boat. 500-1000 blocks wide seems pretty reasonable to me.

Agree, I‚Äôd like the world to look like continents, islands and all oceans interconnected into one water volume surrounding them.

But also I‚Äôd note that some problems are solved using large biomes worlds. Oceans and islands get really large and exciting with large biomes.

It frustrates me that the "salt lake" I always go to does not have warm oceans so there would be no coral reefs for a coral zombie nautilus to spawn. I want my coral zombie nautilus to be together with my nautilus and regular zombie nautilus but transporting the coral variant through large masses of land is ridiculous.

And of course there has to be the volcano exploding right? So like every, I don't know, 40 Minecraft days the volcano spews lava and rocks which can deal damage to you. And the lava is launched into the air so it can also fall down on you and burn any kind of wood, things that are flammable, etc. Maybe each time it explodes it loses some of its strength and after 5 or so explosions it is "dead" and doesn't explode anymore. Also if the lava touches water it becomes cobblestone. Maybe it could also have smoke?
Maybe instead of the badlands, volcanoes should spawn as part of the mountain biomes.
IDEA: 4 words: Volcano shelters for villages. They should be made out of cobblestone and be super tall. And here‚Äôs the most important part: they should have chests with a LOT of food.
Jungle and rainforest means the same thing, but the ideas are actually pretty good!

Jungles r rain forests and Minecraft rainforests should b updated

It would be like a variant of the jungle biome I think
The rainforest could be a nice variant to the jungle!

I love this idea so much. I think there could be monkey/ gorilla tribes too and there could be banana trees that you can use to tame them or befriend them. In return they might come with you and protect you.
This would be cool, but I'd suggest it as a Jungle variant rather than it's own biome.
Nice idea

It will take you to the moon. There you will find a crashed ufo with a boss. Kill the boss and a portal appears to the aliens home plannet. There will be several maps to be found for a blue print to make a teleporting devices. One you build it you can craft teleport pedestals to place any were any dimension and will be able to teleport ther instantly. Resources for this must be extremely difficult to find so that this is not an OP think in the game.
I like that idea just add space crafts that you can craft!
You should also add SPACE RATS as pets that you can tame with SPACE CHEESE!
I think you should have it where you find crashed spaceships with chests containing space suits. And you charge the rocket with redstone. Also if you don't wear the spacesuit you suffocate.

I think they should do a spatial mega-update. space in minecraft does not exist I wish it were possible to build rockets with new ores, space suits, make rocket fuel using redstone and sugar cane I wish I could travel to the moon after building and developing a rocket. if possible, in addition to exploring the planet itself, let's not limit ourselves to it, we can also explore space I find it interesting to start with the possibility of traveling to the moon and then returning with the rocket to the planet, there are several mods that make this happen, it depends on the developers and the mojang to do it!
Maybe with martian villiagers, moon monsters, less gravity, and a moon cow

That's a very interesting idea. I think this way. Very large, many Huge Mushrooms are generated, and Mycelium is also generated. And a rare "cave glowing mushroom" will be generated, and its Huge Mushroom version will also be generated rarely. Mooshroom, bats, and cave spiders also appear in this cave, and the new mushroom-like mob "Myconid" that appears only in this cave is a neutral mob, and when attacked, all other Myconids around it are hostile. .. This mob can be propagated on mushrooms, but it is not good at sunlight. I was thinking about other things, but it looks like this.
If there was a underground mushroom biome, seeing spore spiders would be a welcome change in my opinion. It is usually the same exact mobs underground with little variety.
glow mushrooms!

I can dig it, maybe spawning only at deepslate level? More underground biomes are going to be a welcome addition.
Also, maybe spores could do poison damage? Unique biome hazard.
sounds amazing what about mooshrooms?
Swamp water should be harder to see through than usual and Lilly pads should be dead and alive, on and off.

The biome itself sounds like a good idea but maybe certain areas of the biome would have deeper water by about 5-10 blocks. This would allow mobs like the drowned to appear and give the player a challenge when going through the biome.

I think they should make beaches their own biome officially rather than just the edge of other biomes that touch water. Perhaps the sand under the water doesn‚Äôt drop so suddenly like current beach biomes but rather extend into the water for shallow water. Sunken ships could be here too as like they ran into a sandbar. Parrots could also be here with the seagulls. A new variation of wood with leaves to mimic tropical plants and flowers. The water could be similar to the warm water biomes.
I want a sand block like snow that has multiple layers you can stack on top of each other. It would be perfect for beaches allowing you to walk gradually into the water.

I agree with this. At every point along the water there is a 3-7 block rise unless you are in a swamp.
